subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: banning spam
msgSnippet: Oliver: I started this group 3½ years ago because the majority of the members of the Shaw Alphabet group showed little or no interest in Quikscript. That was
messageBody:
Oliver:

 

I started this group 3½ years ago because the majority of the members of the Shaw Alphabet group showed little or no interest in Quikscript.  That was their right, and I don’t fault them for that.  However, I had gotten tired of QS being denigrated by some, and I wanted a site where the members were interested in QS for its own virtues and did not view it as some afterthought of Kingsley Read of lesser worth than the Shaw Alphabet. 

 

Out of curiosity about a year ago, I compared the e-mail addresses of the Shaw Alphabet members to the Read Alphabet members.  There was some overlap between the two groups, but it was not as extensive as I had anticipated.  My memory is that roughly 20% of the members were signed on to both groups at that time. 

 

Due to the occasional mentioning of the Shaw Alphabet group in Read Alphabet posts and vice versa, it is probable that most members are aware of the other group’s existence.  If those signed on one list are interested in the posts of the other group, they can certainly sign on to the other group so I see no need to combine the two groups at this time.

 

Additionally, the dynamics of the two groups are quite different.  The Read Alphabet group is frequently comatose with many lurkers.  (I would like to change that)  On the other hand, the Shaw Alphabet group loves to discuss minutiae at length.  Of course, that’s just my humble opinion. J

 

 

Paige

 

I, for one, would not mind seeing the two groups merge somehow.  I realize that the two
alphabets are distinct, and of course I don't want to see a which-is-better flame war start;
but it seems to me that the discussions on both lists would be interesting to members of
the other, so...

oliver
